Battery.details: Batteries can be recycled to recover valuable materials such as metals. It is recommended to check with local recycling centers or visit the Environmental Protection Agency website for more information on how to recycle batteries.

Brown glass.details: Brown glass can be recycled and used to create new glass products. Visit the Recycle Glass website to learn more about the recycling process and find recycling centers near you.

Cardboard.details: Cardboard can be recycled through local recycling programs. Visit the Recycle Cartons website to find recycling facilities near you and learn more about recycling cardboard.

Clothes.details: Clothes can be donated to charitable organizations or recycled into new textiles. Visit the Secondary Materials and Recycled Textiles Association (SMART) website to find textile recycling locations and learn more about clothing recycling.

Food items.details: Food waste can be composted to create nutrient-rich soil. Visit the Environmental Protection Agency website to learn about composting food waste and its environmental benefits.

Green glass.details: Green glass can be recycled and used to create new glass products. Visit the Recycle Glass website to learn more about the recycling process and find recycling centers near you.

Metal.details: Metals can be recycled repeatedly without losing their properties. Visit the Steel Recycling Institute website to learn more about metal recycling and find recycling locations near you.

Nothing.details: No specific recycling information is available for this waste category.

Paper.details: Paper can be recycled into new paper products. Visit the Paper Recycling Association website to learn more about paper recycling and find recycling centers near you.

Plastic.details: Plastics can be recycled to create new plastic products. Visit the Plastic Film Recycling website to learn more about plastic recycling and find drop-off locations near you.

Shoes.details: Shoes in good condition can be donated to charitable organizations. Visit the Giving Sole website to learn more about shoe donation and find donation centers near you.

Trash.details: This waste category cannot be recycled and should be disposed of properly in designated trash bins.

White glass.details: White glass can be recycled and used to create new glass products. Visit the Recycle Glass website to learn more about the recycling process and find recycling centers near you.
